title: what's the name of this font
content:
hello all,  
anyone know whats the name of this font?

thank you.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [01.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080930211056/http:/typophile.com/files/01_0.jpg) | 152.1 KB |

 [‹ Parish Logo Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20080930211056/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14679 "Go to previous forum topic") [Double-Line Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080930211056/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14614 "Go to next forum topic")
author: valg4

comments.content: It’s rather difficult to tell from the snapshot you provided — there’s not really enough detail. A lot of the letterforms are similar to Caslon Antique, but there are a few oddballs in there — M, W and a _lambda_-like character — that don’t quite match the standard Caslon Antique Latin letterforms.
yes:) thanx very much! its Caslon Antique some kind of CE version maybe... the letter M=SH, R=G..lol are from the Cyrillic alphabet..lol
